body_html:
It seems I have to manually set mkl cores before using torch. For some reason numpy does that for me.

import mkl
mkl.set_num_threads(56)

import torch

a = torch.rand(10000,100000)
b = torch.rand(100000,10000)
c = a.mm(b)
body_text:
It seems I have to manually set mkl cores before using torch. For some reason numpy does that for me.
import mkl
mkl.set_num_threads(56)

import torch

a = torch.rand(10000,100000)
b = torch.rand(100000,10000)
c = a.mm(b)
body:
It seems I have to manually set mkl cores before using torch. For some reason numpy does that for me.

```
import mkl
mkl.set_num_threads(56)

import torch

a = torch.rand(10000,100000)
b = torch.rand(100000,10000)
c = a.mm(b)
```
